value: Tasik Kenyir and the mountains beyond

) is a reservoir lake formed from the damming of the Kenyir River in Ulu (upriver)

Kenyir Lake is very large and contains some islands. There is a breathtaking view from the top of the dam itself, and many visitors hire a boat to see the rest. There are also caves and a small waterfall nearby.

Because of Tasik Kenyir's inland location and moderate elevation above sea level, its climate is somewhat cooler and moister than on the seacoast.
The best way to access the lake is by car. Make sure you have a map, and if you're travelling from the coast, be prepared for a somewhat lengthy drive on small local roads through

Available at Gawai Jetty HQ. Entry fee RM1, camera RM5, fishing RM10, camping RM1
If you are going into Taman Negara National Park you need an additional permit from the Wildlife Office at Kuala Berang or the National Park entry point at Tanjung Mentong.
You can hire a boat or a boat and guide a short distance to right of the dam, if you are facing the lake from the dam.
Fishing, camping and trekking, visit waterfalls, go to caves, water sports.
After you visit, if you are very adventurous, you can go on a back road into Ulu
. Otherwise, turn back and go east toward the coast of Terengganu.
